value.title: Power BI Apps vs App Workspace (the new Viewer role)
value.excerpt: The viewer role for Power BI App Workspaces is now available! Now, let's look at Power BI Apps vs. App Workspaces and have a discussion around which is the better way to go for content distribution in your enterprise.  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton

value.title: Power BI: Build a custom KPI scorecard
value.excerpt: Patrick walks you through how you can use Power BI to build a custom KPI scorecard. The key is the UNICHAR DAX function.  Demo files: https://guyinacu.be/demofiles  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton -- http://twitter.com/patrickdba -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

value.title: Power BI Reports and Buttons (new with Power BI Desktop - April 2018)
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at Power BI reports and buttons. Buttons were added to Power BI Desktop in the April 2018 release. You can now add buttons to your Power BI reports and configure actions for when they are selected.  Bookmarks and selections are a powerful combination with Power BI reports

value.title: Power BI Tutorial | From Flat File To Data Model
value.excerpt: In this Power BI Tutorial, Patrick looks at how to load data from a flat file to the data model. This could be a text, csv or excel file with a lot of columns. Don't just pull it into Power BI. Take time to structure your data in your data model. From flat file to data model is basic concept, but is

value.title: Power BI: Use DAX to get relative dates
value.excerpt: Patrick looks at how you can get relative dates, in Power BI Desktop, without using the relative date slicer or relative date filters. You just need to sprinkle a little DAX into Power BI Desktop to get this going!  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton

value.title: Describe Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn about the Power BI Desktop model structure, star schema design basics, analytics queries, and report visual configuration. This module provides a strong foundation on which you can learn to optimize model designs and add model calculations.

value.title: Model data in Power BI
value.excerpt: Connect Power BI to multiple data sources to create reports. Define the relationship between your data sources.

value.title: Work with Power BI visuals
value.excerpt: Learn how to choose from the exceptional visuals that Power BI makes available to you. Formatting visuals will direct the user’s attention to exactly where you want it, while helping to make the visual easier to read and interpret. You will also learn about how to use key performance indicators (KPIs).

value.title: Machine Learning in Power BI
value.excerpt: We can utilize Python and Scikit-Learn machine algorithms in Power with the Run Script option. In this example we will do churn analysis using an classification with the Logistic Regression package from Scikit_learn.  Check me out on LinkedIn   https://www.linkedin.com/in/gaelimholland

value.title: Building relationships between tables when both have duplicates
value.excerpt: PowerPivot and Power BI Desktop only allow the creation of relationships between tables when one of columns forming the relationship does not have duplicate values. value.title: DAX Fridays! #3: SUM and SUMX
value.excerpt: Dax Fridays! Today we will go through: how to use SUM() and SUMX(), the difference between them and when should we use one vs the other.  The DAX SUM function calculates the sum of all numbers in a column while the DAX SUMX function returns the sum of an expression for each row in a table.  02:28 Create
